WWData Class

class wwpy.ww_data.WWData(header, mesh, values)[source]

Bases: object

Main interface for WWINP file manipulation.

Parameters:

  • header (Header)

  • mesh (Mesh)

  • values (WeightWindowValues)

__init__(header, mesh, values)
Parameters:

  • header (Header)

  • mesh (Mesh)

  • values (WeightWindowValues)

Return type:

None

apply_ratio_threshold(**kwargs)[source]

Apply a ratio threshold to weight window values.

Identifies and modifies weight window values where the ratio between neighboring cells exceeds a specified threshold. Values exceeding the threshold are set to 0.0.

Parameters:

**kwargs – Parameters passed to WeightWindowValues.apply_ratio_threshold(). See WeightWindowValues.apply_ratio_threshold() for detailed parameter list.

Return type:

None

Example

>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> wwinp.apply_ratio_threshold(
...     threshold=10.0,
...     particle_types=[0],
...     verbose=True
... )
header: Header
mesh: Mesh
multiply(factor=2.0)[source]

Multiply all weight window values by a specified factor.

This operation modifies the weight window values in-place by multiplying each value by the given factor. Useful for adjusting importance sampling.

Parameters:

factor (float) – Multiplication factor to apply. Values > 1 increase weights, values < 1 decrease weights. Default is 2.0.

Return type:

None

Example

>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> wwinp.multiply(2.0)  # Double all weight window values
query_ww(**kwargs)[source]

Query weight window values based on specified criteria.

A flexible query interface that allows retrieving weight window values based on particle type, time, energy, and spatial coordinates.

Parameters:

**kwargs – Query parameters passed to WeightWindowValues.query_ww(). See WeightWindowValues.query_ww() for detailed parameter list.

Returns:

Object containing the queried weight window values and metadata.

Return type:

QueryResult

Example

>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> result = wwinp.query_ww(
...     particle_type=0,
...     energy=(1.0, 10.0),
...     x=(0, 10),
...     y=(0, 10),
...     z=(0, 10)
... )
soften(power=0.6)[source]

Adjust weight window values by applying a power transformation.

This method modifies the weight window values by raising them to a specified power. Values < 1.0 will “soften” the weight windows (reduce the differences between values), while values > 1.0 will “harden” them (increase the differences).

Parameters:

power (float) – Exponent to apply. Default is 0.6. - power < 1.0: softens weight windows - power > 1.0: hardens weight windows - power = 1.0: no effect

Return type:

None

Example

>>> from wwpy import parser
>>> wwinp = parser.from_file("input.wwinp")
>>> wwinp.soften(0.6)  # Soften weight windows
values: WeightWindowValues
write_file(filename)[source]

Write the WWINP data to a file in FORTRAN-compatible format.

This method handles the serialization of all WWINP data components including header information, mesh specifications, and weight window values using FORTRAN-style formatting.

Parameters:

filename (str) – Path where the output file will be written.

Return type:

None
